Job_description:
["At Microsoft, Interns work on real-world projects in collaboration with teams across the world, while having fun along the way. You’ll be empowered to build community, explore your passion, and achieve your goals. This is your chance to bring your solutions and ideas to life while working on cutting-edge technology. The internship is designed not only for you to do great work with the opportunity to learn and grow, but to experience our culture full of diverse community connection, executive engagement, and memorable events.

Imagine yourself as a Microsoft intern. Join Microsoft today and help us innovate and shape the business of tomorrow.

We’re a company of learn-it-alls rather than know-it-alls and our culture is centered around embracing a growth mindset, a theme of inspiring excellence, and encouraging teams and leaders to bring their best each day. Does this sound like you? Learn more about our cultural attributes.

Are you ready to join us and create the future? Come as you are, do what you love—start your journey with us today!
Responsibilities
Role Description
Applications to these opportunities are considered for all available Consulting Services intern roles, including but not limited to, the role described below:

Consultant
Consultants are strategists who work closely with Microsoft's partners to assist customers in the delivery of high-quality engagements around Microsoft's solution areas, technologies, services and products in diverse client environments.

Responsibilities:
Contributes to the pre-sales process by leveraging knowledge of business requirements to successfully offer technical input and solution offerings.
Participates in project planning by identifying risks and dependencies and proposing appropriate mitigations.
Implements technical solutions by coordinating and aligning with customer's business goals.
Cultivates relationships with customers, partners, and stakeholders to identify drivers of satisfaction and establish recovery actions to improve experience.

Project Manager
Project Managers (PJM) have a unique mix of both project management and consulting skills. Driven by a passion for technology, the PJM ensures projects are successfully delivered to our customers on time and meeting specifications.
Responsibilities:
Drives project initiation by prioritizing tasks, proactively removing risks, and creating work breakdown structures.
Develops project management plan to drive project delivery in line with customer needs.
Leverages technical expertise to engage with customer stakeholders and cultivate business relationships.
Builds trusted relationships with customers by reviewing feedback, providing guidance, managing expectations, and adhering to key performance indicators.

Pursuit Lead
Overview
Pursuit Leads are key participants in driving the sales growth of solutions and provide leadership to all domain assigned resources and activities to support opportunity qualification, scoping, estimating, costing, risk identification and mitigations, contract preparation, and delivery of contracted work to the delivery teams.

Responsibilities:
Defines, shapes and scopes quality solutions to satisfy customer requirements and drive business outcomes pre-sales.
Collaborates with sales and the domain to create and execute combined opportunity close plan that outlines owners and their actions and drives deal velocity.
Works with pursuit team to balance customer expectations with Microsoft business goals while mitigating risk and maximizing delivery best practices by applying right shoring and delivery mix capabilities as appropriate for deal complexity.
Qualifications
Basic Qualifications
Currently pursuing a bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, Engineering, or related field with at least one semester/quarter remaining after internship.
Passion for technology and customer obsessed.
Displays strong stakeholder and relationship management skills.
Excellent verbal and written communication, analytical and presentation skills.
Microsoft Product Certification, MCSE or other technical certifications is a plus.

Visit our Careers FAQ Page to learn more about the interview process and answers to commonly asked questions.

Microsoft is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, ancestry, color, family or medical care leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran status, race, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by applicable laws, regulations, and ordinances. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. If you need assistance and/or a reasonable accommodation due to a disability during the application or the recruiting process, please send a request via the Accommodation request form.

Benefits/perks listed below may vary depending on the nature of your employment with Microsoft and the country where you work.", "What is Avesdo?
Avesdo is a real estate services company powered by technology that serves the leading new home developers and their project marketing partners across Canada and we are experiencing tremendous growth in response to our trusted services and platform. To learn more about Avesdo Technologies, visit www.avesdo.com
As a Product data analyst, you will work with the product team to engage client stakeholders, external users, internal software engineering and UI/UX design teammates to bring clarity and alignment from start to finish. You will have a strong analytical and data-driven approach, helping our team organize, visualize and understand large data sets relating to various performance marketing channels. You will participate in deep-dive analytics, creation of regression models, build dashboards and generate reports to drive business growth and draw strategic insights from product and user data.

Job Status: 4 months paid internship at $15/hr, Full-Time hours.
Location: 100% Remote Work (Remote applicants must reside in Canada and have valid Canadian work authorization).
Why you will love it here:
Personal Growth: Mentorship will be available to you and you will learn new things in a rapidly evolving company, grow professionally and have a chance to make your mark on a trillion-dollar real estate industry.
Great Culture: We foster a culture of well-being and connectedness! To keep things fun and stress-free we have a number of team bonding activities including weekly game sessions we like to call B4, Virtual Wellness Sessions (meditation, midday stretches, spring step contest), and much more.
Hyper-Growth: Avesdo is growing exponentially; you'll be joining at an exciting time where your contributions matter every day!
What you'll be doing:
Responsible for creating and maintaining existing KPIs and reporting for engineering and product teams
Propose and implement new metrics that provide actionable insights for our teams and the company. Dig deep into Avesdo’s data to discover insights and correlations.
Utilize our product analytics tool (Pendo) to track user behaviours, gather insights, create metrics, and create guides to engage and educate users
Leverage data and use it to answer business questions and drive strategy & decision making
Access, clean and organize raw data in a way that makes sense for both you and the team
Visualizations: help us to see and understand our data in a way that makes sense, creating automated dashboards and funnels for various internal teams
Remain alert to new techniques for insights, analytics, and data visualization, and devises new ways of applying them
Support product team in user and market research by taking notes, transcribing interviews and recordings, and asking follow up questions.
Harvest new insight from user & market research, customer success, sales opportunities, product analytics data, and other sources
Research and analyze industry trends and benchmarking information as they apply to Avesdo business models and domain needs
Draft release notes and content to support future product releases
Additional opportunities and challenges:
Compile industry research and analysis to validate assumptions and uncover new market opportunities
Conduct competitive product/pricing analysis and market research, evaluate sales performance, and formulates and reviews strategic long-range plans, goals, and objectives for specific product areas
Ideate on new concepts and opportunities to address emerging and future customer needs
Collaborate with Software Developers and Experience Designers to develop and iterate on solutions from initial concept through execution and delivery
Support the product teams with the development and go-to-market launch of new products and capabilities
Who we’re looking for:
Recent graduates preferably in a discipline such as Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics, Statistics or Data Sciences or equivalent
Loves solving difficult problems and finding the ‘right’ solutions
Strong ability to learn new concepts, technologies, and languages
Demonstrated ability to convert ambiguous requirements into an effective solution
Strong written and oral communication skills
Deep interest and aptitude in data, metrics, analysis, and trends and apply knowledge of measurement and statistics to turn data into stories that key stakeholders can understand
Strong Excel skills, including mastery of vlookups, complex formulas, pivot tables and macros
You can write SQL queries & perform data analysis, and know your way around visualization tools
You are naturally curious and have a solid understanding of common statistical methods and their real-world applications
Excellent interpersonal/team skills
Be able to work in an agile project environment
Good attention to details
ERSDdUYJhp", "Konrad
Konrad is a next generation digital consultancy. We are dedicated to solving complex business problems for our global clients with creative and forward-thinking solutions. Our employees enjoy a culture built on innovation and a commitment to creating best-in-class digital products in use by hundreds of millions of consumers around the world. We hire exceptionally smart, analytical, and hard working people who are lifelong learners.
Software Developer Intern
As a Software Developer Intern you'll be paired up with a mentor working on both the front end and back end of our web or mobile applications. Working within the software development team, your duties will require you to assist in the development of consumer and enterprise applications. This role is ideal for entry level developers who feel confident in their technical ability and want to contribute to and learn from the highly-skilled development team at Konrad for the duration of their internship.
Responsibilities
Write maintainable, testable, and performant software in collaboration with our world class team
Participate in code review and performing extensive testing to ensure high quality software
Research new technology and tools and share those findings with the team
Communicate clearly and effectively with all members of our team
Successful candidates will have
Started and currently be enrolled in a Computer Science, Software Engineering, or similar program in a University or College
Strong command of important core programming and computer science concepts
Fundamental knowledge of core web principals (HTTP, browsers, the DOM, SSL, web servers)
Good understanding & experience in HTML/CSS/JavaScript or native Android/iOS development
Great interpersonal skills - we work very closely together as a team and require a lot of communication
Proactive personality, and a desire to deliver your best work
A love for improving software development workflows/process
Perks and Benefits
Mentorship Program
Campus Ambassador Program
Service Recognition Programs
Socials, Outings & Retreats
Culture of Learning & Development
Flexible Working Hours
Work from Home Flexibility
Bonus Points: Have you taken any courses at BrainStation? A lot of our design and development best practices and processes are taught during our courses - make sure to highlight this experience in your cover letter if you have!
Konrad is committed to maintaining a diverse work environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants, regardless of race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status will receive consideration for employment. If you have any accessibility requirements or concerns regarding the hiring process or employment with us, please notify us so we can provide suitable accommodation.
While we sincerely appreciate all applications, only those candidates selected for an interview will be contacted.", 'Royaltymine is an innovative startup focusing on artist crowdfunding, marketing, and music royalty investments. We are combining fintech and music!
This is a remote 3 month full-stack software engineering internship that runs from October to December. You will be working closely with the founder to:
add core platform capabilities
Split parts of the application into microservices
refine deployment on GCP
design and implement new features using third party APIs from major streaming platforms such as Spotify, Apple, etc.
Possibly introduce React-native
Must have working knowledge of at least FOUR of the following:
Javascript
MongoDb
Express
React
Node
React-native
Great to haves:
Docker, Kubernetes, Stripe, Bootstrap, Ant Design, Sendgrid. Practical experience with React-native, general understanding of ecommerce, and interest in the music business are highly desired.
Additional Qualifications:
Must still be an undergraduate student after the internship.
Must be a Canadian citizen or permanent resident
Studying a degree in computer science, software engineering, or equivalent
Submit in one document, your resume, unofficial transcript, links to your pet coding projects if any, and your short answer to the following question. No cover letters please.
Would you rather build something that you think is really useless but most people seem to like, or build something that you think has a lot of utility but most people dislike.
Contract length: 3 months
Application deadline: 2021-09-10
Expected start date: 2021-10-01
Job Types: Full-time, Internship, Contract
Salary: $2,333.00-$3,333.00 per month
Schedule:
8 hour shift
Monday to Friday
No weekends
Work remotely:
Temporarily due to COVID-19', "Job Description
Come intern with one of the largest electrical engineering companies in the world.

Come Intern with our Programmable Solutions Group (PSG).

You will work on some aspect of the Intel Quartus compile system.

Roles and responsibilities may include to work on some of the most difficult and interesting algorithmic problems around.

Qualifications

You must possess the below minimum qualifications to be initially considered for this position. Preferred qualifications are in addition to the minimum requirements and are considered a plus factor in identifying top candidates. Experience listed below would be obtained through a combination of your school work/classes/research and/or relevant previous job and/or internship experiences.

Minimum Requirements:

Must be pursuing a Bachelor's degree in Computer Engineering, Engineering Science, Computer Science, Math, Electrical Engineering or equivalent.

Minimum 3 months of programming experience in C, C++, or Python.

Preferred qualifications:

At least one course in digital logic
Inside this Business Group

The Programmable Solutions Group (PSG) was formed from the acquisition of Altera. As part of Intel, PSG will create market-leading programmable logic devices that deliver a wider range of capabilities than customers experience today. Combining Altera's industry-leading FPGA technology and customer support with Intel's world-class semiconductor manufacturing capabilities will enable customers to create the next generation of electronic systems with unmatched performance and power efficiency. PSG takes pride in creating an energetic and dynamic work environment that is driven by ingenuity and innovation. We believe the growth and success of our group is directly linked to the growth and satisfaction of our employees. That is why PSG is committed to a work environment that is flexible and collaborative, and allows our employees to reach their full potential.

Intel is committed to a culture of accessibility. Intel provides accommodations to applicants and employees with disabilities. Find information and request accommodation here", 'It’s more than a great career. It’s a bright future.
Are you looking to gain invaluable industry experience and fast-track an exciting career?
At Intact, we’re leading an insurance transformation to better protect people, businesses and society. We want future leaders - like you - to help us lead the charge. Join our Artificial Intelligent team as a Back-End Developer for the Winter 2022 Term! In this role, you’ll make a difference while building the skills and experience that will propel your career forward.



About the role


Here, we cultivate an environment that will help you meet your full potential. You’ll be encouraged to seize on challenges, learn from our diverse teams, and grow. As a valued member of the team, you’ll get hands-on business experience, on-the-job coaching and opportunities to build relationships. That’s how we develop the future leaders who will continue to deliver on our purpose to help people, businesses, and society prosper in good times and be resilient in bad times.
What you’ll do here:
Design, test and develop back-end solutions for our artificial intelligence teams;
Stay current on new approaches or opportunities, and bring them to the solutions you design;
Help transforming complex data sets into meaningful conclusions and recommendation;
Work with a Agile team to develop major systems, using the latest Internet and application technologies;
Find technical solutions by brainstorming with other team members and building prototypes, if necessary;
Prepare technical documentation to deploy and support completed systems;
Develop and perform unit tests to validate code;
Provide advice and support other teams in production and skills transfer;
Provide estimates and status reports as needed;
Keep up to date on new technologies and introduce new and practical approaches.
Here are a few reasons why others have joined our team:
An award-winning, inspiring workplace that supports its people and recognizes great work
Stimulating, challenging projects and development opportunities to help you grow your skills and career



Qualifications


What you bring to the table:
Currently pursuing a University degree in software engineering or computer science
Available to work with us full-time for the Winter 2022 Term (January to April)
1 or more terms of relevant internship experience
Object-oriented programming skills
Experience in Python and Java programming
An interest in Java/Kotlin, Docker/Kubernetes, Hazelcast/Redis, Spring Boot/Spring Cloud and MongoDB/Oracle technologies
Knowledge of development design patterns;
Knowledge and interest in Artificial Intelligence
Understand the basics of an agile way of work
A good understanding of the entire software development lifecycle
Bilingualism is an asset (French and English)
Your career starts here. Apply today!
We can’t wait to learn more about you. When you complete your application, remember to include your cover letter, resume, University transcript and links to personal projects you developed. We hire co-ops every semester (Winter, Summer and Fall)! We’re accepting applications now through October 8, 2021 at 11:59pm EST. All submissions will be reviewed during this time, as well as after the posting closes.



Closing Statement


We are an Equal Opportunity Employer
At Intact, our value of Respect is founded on seeing diversity as a strength, being inclusive and fostering collaboration. We value diversity and strive to create an inclusive, accessible workplace where all individuals feel valued, respected and heard.
If we can provide a specific adjustment to make the recruitment process more accessible for you, please advise the Talent Acquisition partner who reaches out about the job opportunity and they will work with you to meet your needs.
Background Checks
As an employer and publicly traded financial services company, the best interests of our customers, employees and shareholders are important to us. We want Intact to be a great place to work! This means that internal and external candidates will be asked to consent to background checks so we can learn more about you. Please note that for positions with access to financial data or funds, your credit must be in good standing.
Internal Candidates
For internal candidates, you can apply for a posted position if you have been in your current position for at least 12 months and are performing at a satisfactory level. Please note we may have identified other internal candidates through our Employee Development Program, and that the selection process may also be opened to external applicants.
Eligibility to Work in Canada
It’s important that you are legally eligible to work in Canada at the time an offer of employment is made. You may be requested to provide proof of eligibility at that time.

studentrelations', "Please Note: This is a paid full-time Summer Internship.
We are looking for a Full Stack Developer Intern to develop and implement Content Management Systems, including Custom PHP, WordPress Multisite and Drupal.
About the Position: The Summer Intern will work on extensions and integrations using their knowledge of the LAMP Stack (Linux, Apache, MySQL, PHP) to enhance functionality and accessibility of Prepr’s online open education resources as well as test for cross-platform and browser compatibility prior to deployment. The individual's work will enhance Preper’s ability to deliver free skills-based education to youth and other community members. The web and mobile platforms improve accessibility to the learning materials. This job provides direct career experience in an ICT field by giving an opportunity to develop Android software applications while working in a team with other designers and developers.
REQUIREMENTS
Education: Seeking student pursuing Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or Engineering.
Required Skills: Proficient at Frontend Web Development including CSS, HTML5, and JavaScript. Knowledge of the LAMP Stack (Linux, Apache, MySQL, PHP).
About our Company: At Prepr, we’re building a global lab network that connects entrepreneurs, intrapreneurs and educators together to co-LEARN, co-LAB, and co-SOLVE™ real-world challenges and create business opportunities.
When the position starts: May 3rd
Contract length: 4 months
Expected Start Date: 2021-09-06

Benefits:
Work from home
Schedule:
Monday to Friday
Experience:
Full stack development: 1 year (required)
Work remotely:
Temporarily due to COVID-19", 'POSITION SUMMARY:
Reporting directly to Director Solutions Development and Implementation, the Coop Student - Programming is responsible to modify applications, system, vendor supplied utilities or packages based on detailed specifications. This includes coding, reviewing, preparing test data, testing and debugging application software, vendor-supplied utilities and/or packages.
DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:
Coding: Under supervision, modifies code, tests, debugs, maintains, modifies, and installs routine to moderately complex programs.
Testing: Under general supervision, develops unit test and test scripts; performs unit, regression, conversion and parallel tests; develops system test data and performs system tests.
Working with customer data and resources to successfully execute coding and conversion work using Unix, SQL, Visual Studio, C or C#, Cobol and Windows script including Winbatch.
Performs other related duties and participates in special projects as assigned.
KNOWLEDGE AND SKILL REQUIREMENTS:
Must be enrolled in Bachelor Degree or College Diploma program in Computer Science.
Must be a self-starter and able to proactively seek help from colleagues where required.
Can demonstrate strong analysis and problem solving skills.
Must have good knowledge and ability to set up test scenarios.
Requires good communication skills, both verbal and written.
Must be able to effectively operate in a remote work environment.
NOTE:
RRD is committed to providing accommodations for people with disabilities. Accommodation will be provided in all parts of the hiring process as required under RRD’s Integrated Accessibility Standards policy. Applicants need to make their needs known in advance. Your request for accommodation requirements will be maintained as personal and confidential. RRD is committed to employment equity and encourages applications from women, Indigenous persons with disabilities and visible minorities and persons of any sexual orientation or gender identity.
Job Types: Full-time, Internship / Co-op
Salary: From $20.00 per hour
Schedule:
8 hour shift
Application question(s):
Are you currently enrolled in a post-secondary education program related to Computer Science?
What is your familiarity with Unix, SQL, Visual Studio, C or C#, Cobol and Windows script including Winbatch?
Work remotely:
Yes', "It’s more than a great career. It’s a bright future.
We aim to be the best insurance AI shop in the world and we’re cultivating the next generation of tech and talent to help us do it. With our team, you’ll get valuable, hands-on industry experience plus the opportunity to fast-track your career in data science.
At Intact, we’re leading an insurance transformation to better protect people, businesses and society. We want future leaders - like you - to help us lead the charge. Join our Intact Lab – Data Science team as a Data Science Co-op/Intern! In this role, you’ll make a difference while building the skills and experience that will propel your career forward.



About the role


Here, we cultivate an environment that will help you meet your full potential. You’ll be encouraged to seize on challenges, learn from our diverse teams, and grow. As a valued member of the team, you’ll get hands-on business experience, on-the-job coaching and opportunities to build relationships. That’s how we develop the future leaders who will continue to deliver on our purpose to help people, businesses, and society prosper in good times and be resilient in bad times.
As a Data Science Co-op/Intern, you will take on stimulating projects that offer opportunities to learn and grow as part of a multidisciplinary team with a mandate to develop and roll out innovative products. CLICK HERE to watch a video on how the #intactlab #datascience team is helping to transform the way millions of Canadians protect the things they love.
You may be a good fit for this role if you:
Have strong analytical and problem-solving skills
Are an effective communicator
Are well organized, with good time management skills
Are able to work independently
Are creative
Are comfortable working as part of a team
What you’ll do here:
Transform complex data sets into meaningful conclusions and recommendations
Participate in developing completely new and innovative solutions, using machine learning, AI and statistical approaches
Get experience working with different types of data including telematics, text data and image data
Be on the lookout for new approaches and opportunities to integrate them into the solutions you design
Here are a few reasons why others have joined our team:
Experience first-hand what it’s like to work as a Data Scientist and learn more about how advances in technology are shaping the way the insurance business works
Explore new ideas and learn best practices in a fun, inclusive environment
Put your creative mind to work while you help the team solve problems and contribute to challenging, meaningful projects
Be a part social events with the team, where you will meet new people and celebrate successes



Qualifications


What you bring to the table:
Bachelor's, Master's or PhD in progress, in artificial intelligence, data science, computer science, mathematics, statistics or a related field
Available to work with us for a 4 month, 8 month or 12 month period (beginning in September 2021)
Practical experience in data science, Machine Learning or deep learning
Practical experience with Python or R programming languages
Knowledge of Big Data tools: Spark, Hadoop, (an asset)
Knowledge of computer visioning or natural language processing (NLP) (an asset)
Understanding of data science approaches in consumer research domains (an asset)
Your career starts here. Apply today!
We can’t wait to learn more about you. When you complete your application, remember to include your cover letter, resume, University transcript and links to personal projects you developed. We hire co-ops every semester (Winter, Summer and Fall)! We’re accepting applications now through October 8, 2021 at 11:59pm EST. All submissions will be reviewed during this time, as well as after the posting closes.



Closing Statement


We are an Equal Opportunity Employer
At Intact, our value of Respect is founded on seeing diversity as a strength, being inclusive and fostering collaboration. We value diversity and strive to create an inclusive, accessible workplace where all individuals feel valued, respected and heard.
If we can provide a specific adjustment to make the recruitment process more accessible for you, please advise the Talent Acquisition partner who reaches out about the job opportunity and they will work with you to meet your needs.
Background Checks
As an employer and publicly traded financial services company, the best interests of our customers, employees and shareholders are important to us. We want Intact to be a great place to work! This means that internal and external candidates will be asked to consent to background checks so we can learn more about you. Please note that for positions with access to financial data or funds, your credit must be in good standing.
Internal Candidates
For internal candidates, you can apply for a posted position if you have been in your current position for at least 12 months and are performing at a satisfactory level. Please note we may have identified other internal candidates through our Employee Development Program, and that the selection process may also be opened to external applicants.
Eligibility to Work in Canada
It’s important that you are legally eligible to work in Canada at the time an offer of employment is made. You may be requested to provide proof of eligibility at that time.

studentrelations", 'At Microsoft, Interns work on real-world projects in collaboration with teams across the world, while having fun along the way. You’ll be empowered to build community, explore your passion, and achieve your goals. This is your chance to bring your solutions and ideas to life while working on cutting-edge technology. The internship is designed not only for you to do great work with the opportunity to learn and grow, but to experience our culture full of diverse community connection, executive engagement, and memorable events.

Imagine yourself as a Microsoft intern. Join Microsoft today and help us innovate and shape the business of tomorrow.

We’re a company of learn-it-alls rather than know-it-alls and our culture is centered around embracing a growth mindset, a theme of inspiring excellence, and encouraging teams and leaders to bring their best each day. Does this sound like you? Learn more about our cultural attributes.

Are you ready to join us and create the future? Come as you are, do what you love—start your journey with us today!
Responsibilities
Role Descriptions
Applications to these opportunities are considered for all available Customer Success intern roles, including but not limited to, those described below:

Cloud Solution Architect
The purpose of the Customer Success Unit is to guide our customers to better deploy, adopt, and gain long-term business value from their investment in Microsoft. In turn, their successes will ensure we grow our Azure consumption. Ultimately, when customers are successful, we are successful. Cloud Solution Architects (CSA) drive high priority customer initiatives on the Microsoft Azure Platform in collaboration with customers and the Microsoft in-field strategic accounts segment of our business. This is a customer facing role, owning overall technical relationship between a customer and Microsoft Azure Applications Development Platform.

Responsibilities:
Provides technical expertise through sales presentations, product demonstrations, installation, and maintenance of company products.
Assists the sales staff in assessing potential application of company products to meet customer needs and preparing detailed product specifications for the development and implementation of customer applications/solutions.
Ensures that the product application/solution is functioning according to specifications.
Provide follow-up support to company sales staff and customer personnel by disseminating technical information on specific applications.

Qualifications
Basic Qualifications
Currently pursuing a bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, Engineering, or related field with at least one quarter/semester remaining to complete after internship.
Passion for technology and customer obsessed.
Displays strong stakeholder and relationship management across senior leaders, partners, and customers.
Excellent verbal and written communication, analytical and presentation skills

Visit our Careers FAQ Page to learn more about the interview process and answers to commonly asked questions.

Microsoft is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, ancestry, color, family or medical care leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran status, race, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by applicable laws, regulations and ordinances. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. If you need assistance and/or a reasonable accommodation due to a disability during the application or the recruiting process, please send a request via the Accommodation request form.

Benefits/perks listed below may vary depending on the nature of your employment with Microsoft and the country where you work.', "Join us as we pursue our disruptive new vision to make machine data accessible, usable and valuable to everyone. We are a company filled with people who are passionate about our product and seek to deliver the best experience for our customers. At Splunk, we’re committed to our work, customers, having fun and most importantly to each other’s success. Learn more about Splunk careers and how you can become a part of our journey!
Role:
Splunk is looking for highly motivated new grads or early in career talent to join our team. You will work on real projects that go to market. You will also have an opportunity to enjoy our dynamic, startup-like environment. You will get invaluable work experience at a leader in “Big Data”, the hottest software market now, and you will have the opportunity to focus on full-stack, backend or front-end technologies.
You will experience Splunking and what defines our culture while honing the skills which separate our development teams from others. Working to support internal and external customer needs, you will collaborate with cross-functional teams, receive mentorship, and gain insight into our values-driven process. Our goal is both to support your growth and development while empowering you for a successful start to your career.
Responsibilities:
As a Software Engineer you will be responsible for …
Building innovative solutions that enables rapid development. You will get to work with a super smart bunch of folks who are doing state of the art development work (native mobile, front-end and back-end, DevOps) in areas of machine learning, data analytics, infrastructure and event correlations across silos to build best-in-class business analytics software. You will be interacting with product management and customers to understand detailed requirements. You will also work with other engineering teams across Splunk to design and build high-performance solutions.
You will design, develop, code and test software systems, or applications for software improvements and new products.
You will actively contribute through participation in agile development of project timelines, implementation design specifications, system flow diagrams, documentation, testing, and ongoing support of systems.
Your voice will have an impact through your recommended modifications to processes and procedures, and directly contribute to standard methodologies, architecture, and implementation.
Requirements:
A Bachelor's degree, Master’s degree, or PhD in Computer Science, Software Engineering, Computer Engineering, Electrical Engineering, Mathematics or a related technical field, or equivalent practical experience.
A minimum of 1 relevant internship, research assistantship, or teaching assistantship
No more than 2 years of full-time professional work experience
Demonstrated experience with object-oriented programming concepts and languages, such as C++, Python, Java
Familiarity with large-scale software architecture, networking and distributed systems, and UNIX/Linux environments

Myant Response To COVID-19 Pandemic – Research and Technology Development for Smart Textile Solutions builds The Myant Skiin Connected Life App. It is a collaborative family informatics application which connects seniors, other family members, friends, and caregivers, to enable health and wellness related data sharing and support. Skiin differs from other products as it is based on Myant’s highly accurate intelligent textiles garments which collect activity and related biomechanical data through knitted sensors on the garment. Data are then transferred from the garment pod to the mobile Skiin app via Bluetooth. Our design seeks to deliver seamless human-computer interaction through effective data presentation, visualization, and tool tips. Data visualization is one of the core strategies that health and wellness applications use to allow individuals to manage, analyze and share their data, including for senior users. We are researching all aspects of design from visualization to user interaction to the programming needed for implementation and to add a predictive capacity, for example with heart health. This phase of the project focuses on software engineering to complete the Skiin prototype, take it to market, evaluate outcomes and improve Skiin.
Responsibilities:
With the assistance of a senior/lead developer they will research and translate product requirements into reliable, maintainable, and scalable code.
Interns will work closely with Myant UX, hardware, and data science teams to transform innovative technology into groundbreaking products.
The intern will support software research and build the next generation of user experience, linking the mobile platform built in native Android and iOS code to the Bluetooth enabled wearable clothing pod and smart textile garments.
Research and implement an interface with Bluetooth Low Energy sensors and web-based APIs, as part of Myant’s massively distributed wearable IoT platform.
Working closely with Myant UX designers, they will implement intuitive UIs.
They will research and implement an interface with Bluetooth Low Energy sensors and web-based APIs, as part of Myant’s massively distributed wearable IoT platform
They will rapidly prototype under an agile, test-driven development environment, hence learning about industry-standing rapid prototyping.
They will strengthen their ability to diagnose and fix bugs and performance bottlenecks for performance in Agile framework.

Current enrolment in a relevant undergraduate or graduate degree at OCAD University
Capacity in JavaScript, Java, and Swift programming languages.
Experience in implementing Native Android and iOS code.

Data visualization skills an asset.

Self-motivated.
